intro: Aylostera albipilosa, commonly known as the white-haired aylostera, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy, silver-green leaves and showy, pale pink to white flowers. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. Aylostera albipilosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and delicate blooms.
